data: Negative Pressure Wound Therapy (VAC) (Module)
Patient Care

Indications:  - Surgical wound   - Open abdomen   - Pressure ulcer   - Diabetic ulcer   - Orthopaedic wound   - Enterocutaneous fistula   - Traumatic wound   - Cardiothoracic wound   - Post Split Thickness Skin Graft (STSG)   - Vascular wound   - Flap

Contraindications:  - Dry necrotic eschar or greater than 25% non-viable tissue on wound bed   - Allergy to dressing supplies   - Narrow sinus tracts that prevent insertion and removal of foam   - Nonenteric or unexplored enteric fistula   - Malignancy within the wound   - Untreated osteomyelitis   - Delivery of solution to thoracic or abdominal cavity (veraFlo)

Wound Precautions:  - Active bleeding/difficult haemostasis/anticoagulant therapy    - Enterocutaneous fistula - consider consult to Wound Ostomy Continence Nurse (WOCN)    - Exposed tendon and/or bone - consider use of interface   - Split thickness skin graft - must use interface     - Sharp edges/bone fragments - must use interface    - Open abdomen - must use interface   - Insufficient intact skin around the wound to maintain an airtight seal    - Insufficient vascularity - may need to lower pressure settings    - Exposed blood vessels / nerves / organs - always consult attending physician

Wound Care Goals:  - Prep for surgical closure   - Prep for graft/flap   - Wound closure   - Wound cleansing   - Incision/fistula closure   - Post Split Thickness Skin Graft (STSG)   - Excessive Drainage
Communication Order
Turn therapy off prior to dressing change
If unable to maintain Negative Pressure Wound Therapy for a minimum of 22 hours/day, discontinue therapy and apply alternative dressing selected below:
Conditional Order - Ongoing
If/when Wound depth less than 1 cm, then use cover dressing appropriate for amount of exudate. Change daily and PRN
If/when Wound depth more than 1cm, then use saline moistened gauze with cover dressing. Change daily and PRN
If/when Closed incisional therapy, then use breathable cover dressing. Change daily and PRN
If/when Graft, then use non-adherent contact layer with breathable cover dressing. Change daily and PRN
Other:
Conditional Order - Ongoing
If/when machine is turned off for more than 2 hours, then normal saline compress q8h to be applied
